meanings.definition: To move easily without using power
meanings.sent1: The bicycle coasted down the hill effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The boat coasted along the calm river.
meanings.sent3: The car coasted to a stop at the traffic light.
meanings.sent4: She coasted through the exam with minimal effort.
meanings.sent5: The skateboarder coasted gracefully along the sidewalk.

meanings.definition: To sail along without using power
meanings.sent1: The sailboat coasted smoothly across the lake.
meanings.sent2: The ship coasted through the open sea.
meanings.sent3: The canoe coasted to the shore without paddling.
meanings.sent4: The yacht coasted elegantly under the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The fishing boat coasted gently in the breeze.

meanings.definition: To move or progress easily without effort
meanings.sent1: After the hard work, the project coasted to completion.
meanings.sent2: The student coasted through the assignment with ease.
meanings.sent3: The team coasted to victory in the final game.
meanings.sent4: The company coasted to success with their new product.
meanings.sent5: The artist coasted to fame after their latest exhibition.
